path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/Verichains_Lab/Verichains Public Audit Report - PandExchange Smartcontracts - v1.1.pdf

findings.title: Calculation `_amountPerOccurrence` may lead to users swapping more than expected
findings.description: The calculation of `_amountPerOccurrence` can result in users swapping more tokens than expected due to rounding down of `ownerFee/_totalOccurrences`, leading to the last swap failing because there are not enough tokens in the contract.

findings.title: Miscalculation of `tokenInLockedAmount` Variable
findings.description: The calculation of `tokenInLockedAmount` is incorrect, leading to potential errors in the smart contract.

findings.title: False control of slippage
findings.description: The function `getAmountsOut()` in `executeSingleUserDCA()` calculates the amount to be executed at a block, with no slippage, allowing attackers to perform a sandwich attack to drain funds from the contract.

findings.title: Users may lose money if they deposit more than the required number of native tokens
findings.description: If users deposit more than the required number of native tokens, they may experience financial losses due to incorrect token transfers.
